newsitem.title: USA: Nextel to get Motorola financing.
newsitem.headline: Nextel to get Motorola financing.

text.p: Nextel Communications Inc said Monday that Motorola would give it up to $450 million in equipment financing after saying that it and Motorola had reached a pact relating to integrated digital enhanced network equipment and digital wireless communications networks.
Nextel said Motorola's commitment provides for financing of U.S. purchases of equipment and services provided by Motorola in addition to existing financing commitments.

It said the pact involves global purchases of integrated digital enhanced network equipment (iDEN) to be used in the Nextel National Network in the United States. The pact also involves digital wireless communications networks to be built and operated affiliates of Nextel's subsidiary, McCaw International Ltd, in Brazil, Argentina, Mexico and the Philippines, Nextel said.

Nextel said the pact covers domestic and international iDEN infrastructure and handset pricing terms and arrangements relating to potential domestic rebates on certain quantities and types of subscriber units based on the volume of purchases of infrastructure equipment.

"Today's actions will enhance our overall competitiveness and allow us to build aggressively the largest single land-based wireless communications network in the western hemisphere based upon a single all-digital platform," Nextel said in a release.
